name: Scallion Pancakes (Shallot Pancakes)
description: My favourite Chinese restaurant treat, made at home! So easy, and unbelievably good. The roll out dough will keep in the fridge for a couple of days, or you can freeze them, then pop them in the pan when you are ready to cook (you don't even need to defrost them). They are best eaten fresh off the stove!
recipeIngredient: 2 cups chopped shallots (aka green onions, shallots) ((half a large bunch))
Oil spray ((any is fine, except olive oil))
Black vinegar ((or substitute with white vinegar))

recipeInstructions.text: Combine flour and 1 tsp salt in a bowl, add water in 3 batches, mixing in between with a spoon (see notes for tips on getting the dough right).
recipeInstructions.name: Combine flour and 1 tsp salt in a bowl, add water in 3 batches, mixing in between with a spoon (see notes for tips on getting the dough right).

recipeInstructions.text: Knead for a minute, either in the bowl or on a flour dusted surface, then cover with cling wrap and rest for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead for a minute, either in the bowl or on a flour dusted surface, then cover with cling wrap and rest for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll out dough thinly into a rectangle should about 1.5ft/50cm x 8"/20cm.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll out dough thinly into a rectangle should about 1.5ft/50cm x 8"/20cm.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray lightly with oil (any oil is fine - except perhaps olive oil), then roll it up starting from the wide end so you have a long roll.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray lightly with oil (any oil is fine - except perhaps olive oil), then roll it up starting from the wide end so you have a long roll.

recipeInstructions.text: Coil it into a snail shape, push down with your hand and roll out again into the same shape.
recipeInstructions.name: Coil it into a snail shape, push down with your hand and roll out again into the same shape.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray again with oil, scatter over the chopped scallions and a pinch of salt. Then roll it up again, starting from the wide end.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray again with oil, scatter over the chopped scallions and a pinch of salt. Then roll it up again, starting from the wide end.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the roll in half, and coil each roll.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the roll in half, and coil each roll.

recipeInstructions.text: Repeat with the other ball of dough. You will end up with 4 coils.
recipeInstructions.name: Repeat with the other ball of dough. You will end up with 4 coils.

recipeInstructions.text: Flatten each coil, then roll out into round shapes about 1/3 " / 0.5 cm thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Flatten each coil, then roll out into round shapes about 1/3 " / 0.5 cm thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 tbsp oil in pan, pan fry for 1 1/2 minutes on the first side, then 1 minute on the other side, pushing down with a spatula if necessary to get it to cook the surface evenly. It should be a dark golden brown colour.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1 tbsp oil in pan, pan fry for 1 1/2 minutes on the first side, then 1 minute on the other side, pushing down with a spatula if necessary to get it to cook the surface evenly. It should be a dark golden brown colour.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine equal parts of soy sauce and black vinegar into a small sauce dish, and add a dollop of Asian chilli paste.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine equal parts of soy sauce and black vinegar into a small sauce dish, and add a dollop of Asian chilli paste.

review.reviewBody: This was my first time making these pancakes. I did struggle with flattening them out as much as possible and the end results weren't perfect, but they taste amazing as does that sauce! Will be attempting these again in the future!

For my first go, these turned out very well. I just need to balance my rolling thickness to stickiness ratio. 
Flavour was delicious.
Thank you for your entire website - such inspiration and I am so happy to try new things (which I know will be delicious!!)
I just made these - what an excellent breakfast! They're delicious! They are so filling - I'm going to freeze the rest and air fry them later. Thanks for the awesome recipe!
